message.content:
<<<api>>>: Apache POI
<<<code>>>: 
1. First, you need to add the Apache POI dependency to your project. You can do this by adding the following Maven dependency to your pom.xml file:

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi</artifactId>
    <version>4.1.2</version>
</dependency>

2. Then, you can use the following code to read the Excel file and insert the data into the database:

// Assuming you have a FileInputStream object called "fileInputStream" that represents the uploaded Excel file
Workbook workbook = WorkbookFactory.create(fileInputStream);

// Assuming you have a Connection object called "connection" that represents your database connection
Connection connection = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mydatabase", "username", "password");

// Assuming you have a PreparedStatement object called "statement" that represents your database insert statement
PreparedStatement statement = connection.prepareStatement("INSERT INTO mytable (ID, IP1, IP2, USER, TKTNO) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?)");

Sheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0); // Assuming the data is in the first sheet

Iterator<Row> rowIterator = sheet.iterator();
rowIterator.next(); // Skip the header row

while (rowIterator.hasNext()) {
    Row row = rowIterator.next();
    
    int id = (int) row.getCell(0).getNumericCellValue();
    String ip1 = row.getCell(1).getStringCellValue();
    String ip2 = row.getCell(2).getStringCellValue();
    String user = row.getCell(3).getStringCellValue();
    String tktNo = row.getCell(4).getStringCellValue();
    
    statement.setInt(1, id);
    statement.setString(2, ip1);
    statement.setString(3, ip2);
    statement.setString(4, user);
    statement.setString(5, tktNo);
    
    statement.executeUpdate();
}

// Close the resources
statement.close();
connection.close();
workbook.close();

<<<explanation>>>: This code uses Apache POI to read the Excel file and JDBC to insert the data into the database. It assumes that you have already set up the database connection and have a table called "mytable" with the same column names as the Excel file. The code skips the header row and iterates over each row in the sheet, extracting the values from each cell and inserting them into the database using a prepared statement.
